snippet: Rapid assimilation is sweeping through every branch of Judaism except the Orthodox, according to the results of a major survey.
abstract: First major survey of American Jews in more than 10 years, conducted by Pew Research Center's Religion & Public Life Project, finds significant shift, including rise in those who are not religious, marry outside faith and are not raising their children Jewish; rapid assimilation is sweeping through every branch of Judaism with exception of Orthodox.
lead_paragraph: Rapid assimilation is sweeping through every branch of Judaism except the Orthodox, according to the results of a major survey.

headline.main: Poll Shows Major Shift in Identity of U.S. Jews
